text:
I think that schools should not allow parents to monitor their children's grades and attendance online. Firstly, it's important for kids to have some privacy and independence. If parents are always checking their grades and attendance, it can feel like they're being watched all the time. This can be really stressful for kids and can make them feel like they can't do anything wrong.

Secondly, it's important for kids to learn how to take responsibility for their own education. If parents are always checking up on them, it can make it harder for kids to learn how to motivate themselves and stay organized. It's important for kids to learn how to set their own goals and track their own progress.

Furthermore, allowing parents to monitor grades and attendance online can create a power imbalance between parents and teachers. Teachers are the experts in education, and they should be the ones responsible for evaluating student progress. If parents are able to monitor grades and attendance, it can undermine the authority of teachers and make it harder for them to do their job effectively.

Finally, it's important to consider the potential consequences of allowing parents to monitor grades and attendance online. If parents are able to see their child's grades and attendance in real-time, it can create a lot of pressure on kids to perform well. This can lead to stress and anxiety for kids, which can negatively impact their mental health.

In conclusion, while it may seem like a good idea to allow parents to monitor their children's grades and attendance online, it's not the best approach. It's important to respect kids' privacy, help them learn how to take responsibility for their own education, maintain a healthy power dynamic between parents and teachers, and avoid putting too much pressure on kids. Instead, parents should have regular meetings with teachers to discuss their child's progress and work together to find ways to support their child's education.
prompt: Some schools have implemented policies that allow parents to monitor their children's grades and attendance online. Argue for or against this practice, providing reasons and examples to support your position.

Praise, it's something we all love to hear, especially as students. But have you ever wondered how it affects our self-esteem? I mean, sure, it feels good to know that our teachers and parents are proud of us, but does it really make a difference in the long run? I decided to investigate and find out.

First, let's talk about the impact of praise on self-esteem. It makes sense that when we receive praise, we feel good about ourselves. It's like a pat on the back, a nod of approval from someone we respect. But too much praise can be a bad thing. When we're constantly being told we're the best, the smartest, the most talented, we start to believe it. And that can lead to a big ego. Suddenly, we're not just trying to do our best, we're trying to live up to these unrealistic expectations. It's like we're walking on eggshells, worried that if we don't meet these expectations, we'll lose the praise and the validation that comes with it.

On the other hand, what happens when we don't receive any praise? Does it mean we're not motivated to do our best? Not necessarily. I mean, think about it. When we're working on a project or studying for a test, we're not doing it for the praise. We're doing it because we want to learn and do well. And when we finally finish that project or get that good grade, it feels good, regardless of whether anyone else notices or not. It's like we're doing it for ourselves, not for anyone else's approval.

So, what can we learn from this? Well, I think it's important to strike a balance between praise and self-motivation. While it's great to receive praise, we shouldn't rely on it too much. Instead, we should focus on our own goals and motivations, and work towards them because we want to, not because we want to impress others. That way, we can build our self-
prompt: Task: Investigate the impact of praise on a student's self-esteem, and explore the motivations and effects of achieving goals without any praise.

text:
After school programs have become increasingly popular for both students and teachers. Not only do they provide students and teachers with the opportunity to learn new material, but they also allow for the chance to gain better grades on quizzes and tests. These programs offer the ability for both students and teachers to apply the knowledge they have gained throughout the school day, something that is essential for career and academic success. Through after school programs, students and teachers have the chance to volunteer to help others understand or finish tasks, which not only reinforces their knowledge but also promotes camaraderie and team-building skills. 

Having an after school program provides crucial insight into real-world scenarios and fosters students’ extracurricular abilities. It presents students with essential leadership and problem-solving skills that help them excel beyond a learning environment. Through creative, hands-on learning, students stay ahead in their classes and gain a better understanding of their overall academic performance. For teachers, after school programs can provide unique perspectives on certain topics that can be applied in their classroom materials. 

Overall, having an after school program is a beneficial endeavor for both students and teachers. It encourages knowledge application, promotes career and academic success, and allows students and teachers the opportunity to cultivate skills they may not possess in the classroom setting.

- the benefits of having knowledge and being able to apply it
- the importance of learning new material and staying ahead in class
- the prospect of gaining better grades in quiz and tests

text:
I believe that the use of animals in scientific research is not ethical. Animals should not be used for human benefit or advancement. Animals also have feelings and emotions like humans, so they should be treated with respect and dignity.

One reason why animals should not be used in scientific research is because it causes them pain and suffering. Animals are often subjected to tests that involve painful procedures, such as injecting them with drugs or exposing them to harmful chemicals. This can cause physical and emotional distress for the animals, which is not fair.

Another reason why animals should not be used in scientific research is because there are alternative methods that can be used. For example, computer models and simulations can be used to predict the effects of drugs and chemicals on humans. This eliminates the need for animal testing and reduces the harm caused to animals.

Furthermore, animals have different physiological and genetic makeup compared to humans, so the results of animal testing may not always be accurate or applicable to humans. Therefore, it is not reliable to use animals as test subjects for human products or treatments.

In conclusion, the use of animals in scientific research is unethical and unnecessary. Alternative methods should be used to reduce the harm caused to animals, and humans should not benefit at the expense of animals' suffering. It is our responsibility to protect and respect all living beings, including animals.
prompt: The use of animals in scientific research has been a topic of ethical debate. Argue for or against the use of animals in scientific research, providing reasons and examples to justify your position.

text:
Sure, here's my attempt at writing an essay as an 8th grade student:

Homework clubs? Ugh, do we really have to? I know I'm not the only one who thinks that. But hear me out, okay? I think after school homework clubs are actually pretty cool. I mean, think about it. We get to stay after school and work on our assignments in a super chill environment. No distractions, no noise, just us and our books. It's like a study session, but way more fun.

First of all, homework clubs help us learn. Like, duh. We get to review what we learned in class and make sure we understand it. If we don't get it the first time, we can ask our teachers for help. And if we're really struggling, we can work in groups and help each other out. It's like a study group, but way more efficient. Plus, we get to take breaks and play games or do something fun while we work. It's not like we're stuck there for hours doing boring work.

And guess what? It actually works. Like, I know people who were struggling in math and they started going to the homework club and now they're getting A's. It's crazy! And it's not just math, it's all subjects. We can work on our reading comprehension, or science experiments, or whatever. It's like a study party.

But it's not just good for us, it's good for the school too. Think about it. If we're all doing better in school, our grades go up and that means the school looks better too. And if we're all doing well, we're more likely to get into good colleges and stuff. It's like, a win-win situation.

Plus, it's a great way to make new friends. I know I've made some really cool friends in the homework club. We can work together and help each other out, and it's not like we're stuck there forever. We can take breaks and hang out during lunch or at recess. It's like, a whole new social scene.

So yeah, homework clubs are actually pretty cool.
prompt:
Task: 
Write a persuasive essay arguing in favor of after school homework clubs. Explain how the clubs help students learn, raise their grades, and develop good study habits. Include the potential benefits for the students and for the school as a whole.

text:
Attending school is a vital step in any individual's life and is imperative to achieving future success. School provides an array of experiences and lessons that cannot be taught outside of the classroom. Education helps to foster the development of necessary life skills such as problem solving, communication, and critical thinking. In addition, formal schooling introduces students to a number of career pathways that can shape their educational and professional paths for years to come.

However, prioritizing school is not always a simple task. Some students may struggle to stay focused due to the variety of distractions brought on by life outside of the classroom. Financial obligations, mental health issues and family responsibilities can take precedence and lead some students astray from their primary focus of attending school. For example, Samantha was unable to attend college due to the financial strain and having to become the primary provider for her household. Despite her determination to further her studies, she was met with a delayed success. 

The importance of attending school is inarguable and should not be taken lightly. With every educational opportunity, come a multitude of greater opportunities. Education serves as the explorer's map to success for the future. Although education does not guarantee the outcome, it does afford us the tools needed to take us one step closer to our eventual success.
prompt:
Task: 

Write an essay discussing why it is important to attend school. Explore how going to school can lead to future success and why it is difficult for some students to prioritize education. Use examples to illustrate your points.

text:
Dear Principal,

I'm writing to express my thoughts on the new sports policy that was recently implemented in our school. While I understand the intention behind it, I believe that it has had a negative impact on many students, including myself.

Firstly, I think it's crucial for everyone to have the opportunity to participate in the sports they are interested in. Sports are a great way to stay active, make new friends, and learn important life skills like teamwork and discipline. By limiting the number of sports teams and activities, the policy is taking away the chance for many students to experience these benefits. For example, I'm really interested in joining the robotics club, but since there's only one team allowed per grade level, I won't be able to participate.

Moreover, I've noticed that some students who are not selected for the sports teams they wanted to join have become disengaged and disruptive in class. They feel left out and unmotivated, which can lead to poor academic performance and even criminal activity. For instance, I've seen some students get into fights or engage in other negative behaviors because they're feeling upset about not being able to participate in the sports they love.

Personally, I've been affected by the policy as well. I'm a member of the school's debate team, but I was not selected for the basketball team, which I had been looking forward to joining. While I understand that the school has to make tough decisions, I feel like my interests and passions are not being taken into account.

In conclusion, I believe that the new sports policy has had a negative impact on many students, including myself. I urge you to reconsider the policy and find a way to provide more opportunities for students to participate in the sports they are interested in. By doing so, we can create a more inclusive and supportive school environment that promotes academic and personal growth.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
prompt:
Task:

Write an essay to the principal, expressing your views on the school's new sports policy. Discuss why it is important for everyone to be provided with the opportunity to participate in the sports they are interested in, and explain how the policy has impacted you and other students. Include examples of how it has led some students into criminal activity.

text:
Distance learning may have its advantages for those who are unable to attend physical classes due to challenging family or work commitments. However, it is important to consider that students may not be able to benefit fully from this style of learning.

The main issue is that this environment is full of potential distractions. Students may be easily tempted by electronic devices or the company of their parents, siblings or friends. This means that much of their attention is potentially not focused on school work, which can have a detrimental effect on their progress and educational attainment.

Another concern is that some students may find distance learning dull, and struggle to concentrate and learn on their own. Without the support of their teacher, the individualised guidance needed to fully understand concepts or problems might be lacking. This can lead to them feeling disengaged with their education, and reluctant to continue to learn.

Finally, due to the lack of a physical break in a technician's routine, fatigue can easily impair their concentration and performance. Without physical activity, regular breaks and structure, students may feel overwhelmed or exhausted by having to make it through the day, which can lead to issues with maintaining mental and physical health.

In conclusion, despite some advantages, distance learning does not necessarily provide an ideal environment for students who wish to focus on their studies. The potential for multiple distractions, lack of teacher guidance and added stress of regular study on their own, can create difficulties for learners who are looking to excel in their chosen field.
prompt:
Task: 

Write an essay that explains why students would not benefit from being able to attend classes from home via distance learning. Consider the following points: 
- Students may be easily distracted by cell phones, electronic devices, their parents, or siblings. 
- Some students may find it difficult or boring to learn on their own pace.
- Students may feel fatigued or weak after school due to lack of rest.

text:
First impressions can be incredibly powerful, but they can also be deceiving. When someone first meets another person, they often form a quick opinion of them, based on their physical appearance, their demeanor, and their mannerisms. Unfortunately, these initial impressions can be wrong and misleading, and they can influence our subsequent behavior when interacting with this person. While it can be difficult to change a first impression, it is possible to learn more and make better decisions about a person based on further interactions and conversations. 

First impressions can be seductive in their reliability, but we must be wary of placing too much weight on them. People are complex and multi-faceted, and a single impression can only tell us so much. Our initial judgments can influence our behavior and cause us to have prejudices against a person we don’t really know. We must remember to take our time and get to know someone before forming a lasting opinion of them. 

In conclusion, our first impressions can be unreliable and potentially harmful if we rely on them too much, so we must be wary of their powerful influence. Taking the time to really get to know a person can help us create informed and accurate opinions that can shape our future interactions with them.
prompt: Task: Write an essay exploring how first impressions can be changed and how they are often unreliable.

text:
When we encounter difficult obstacles and challenges in life, it is beneficial to seek advice and guidance from experts and authorities. In these matters, having knowledge and experience can be extremely valuable. Experts can provide us with the perspective we need to have a successful outcome in our lives. They can provide us with the guidance to help us succeed, to be able to move on after a failure or setback, and to know when we need to ask for help. 

By seeking out guidance from those who have been through similar experiences, we can assess our own situation objectively and understand the best way to move forward. Experts can provide a variety of life strategies to help us navigate the tough terrain of life. They can analyze our struggles, offer advice and provide resources that can assist us in getting to our desired goal. They can provide insight on how to approach problems and how to navigate the big and small decisions we make.

In addition to providing us with strategies to succeed, experts can also give us the emotional support and encouragement that we need. Through these relationships with experts, we can build the resilience and confidence we need to overcome setbacks and gain a sense of personal empowerment.

Ultimately, seeking input from experts and authorities in life's important matters can be invaluable. Advice and guidance from those who have the experience and knowledge to help us can be crucial in pushing us forward and helping us achieve our goals.
prompt:
Task: 
Write an essay about the importance of seeking advice and guidance from experts and authorities in life's important matters. Evaluate the advantages of having experts provide guidance on how to succeed in life, how to overcome failures and setbacks, and how it is important to ask for help.

text:
Summer vacations provide teens with a unique opportunity to take a break from the normal routine of the academic year and spend more time with their friends and family. Studies have found that longer summer vacations have many benefits, such as providing more time for socialization, improving mood and cognition, and broadening opportunities for exploration and discovery. Additionally, longer summer vacations can help strengthen family bonds, as teens are able to spend more quality time with their parents, siblings, and extended family.

However, there are potential drawbacks associated with longer summer vacations. Teens who have a lengthy amount of time away from school-related activities and responsibilities may experience a drop in academic performance, as disruptive behavior can manifest from boredom. Without the structure of school, teens may also fall into negative habits, such as reckless decision-making or addiction to social media and other electronic devices.

In conclusion, the advantages and disadvantages of longer summer vacation must be taken into consideration by families. If planned and organized in concert with parents and school staff, longer summer vacations can be beneficial for teens as they can spend more time with their family and friends. At the same time, the right balance of structure and autonomy should be observed to ensure that teens can make the most of their time away from school.
prompt: Task: Research the advantages of longer summer vacations on how that influences teens to spend more time with their family and friends. Analyze if there are any negative effects associated with longer summer vacations and discuss the implications.

text:
As humans, we have a natural instinct to follow the example of those around us. When someone we look up to demonstrates a desired behavior, such as productivity or politeness, we are far more likely to model that behavior. Setting the right example, then, is an effective way to influence those around us. 

This is clearly seen in organizations or other teams of people, such as in the military or office settings. Leaders who demonstrate a desire to work together to achieve goals, respect the opinions of others, and maintain a positive attitude build teams of like-minded individuals. Similarly, those who choose to promote a culture of deceit, hostility, or laziness will find it far more difficult to get team members to buy in, and their desired results will suffer.

Speeches can also be effective in influencing those around us. A well-crafted speech, delivered with conviction, passion, and clarity, can be incredibly impactful. Speeches can shape opinions and create cohesion around certain points of view, often elevating morale and inspiring change. 

Finally, trustworthiness can also be a strong influencer in terms of human behavior. Individuals are far more likely to heed the words of those around them if their trust is well-placed in that person. If someone has consistently proven themselves to be reliable, honest, and dependable, those traits will make others more likely to be influenced by that person. 

In conclusion, setting a good example through one’s own behavior is an effective way to influence those around us. But it must be used in conjunction with speeches, trustworthiness, and other desirable traits and behaviors to be truly effective. When the right mix of these strategies is employed, individuals can be highly influential in society.
prompt: Task: Write an essay discussing if setting a good example by one's own behaviour is the best way to influence other people, or if there are better ways to influence others. Consider the effectiveness of speeches, trustworthiness, and actions in comparison to setting an example. Use examples to illustrate and support the points you make.

text:
Hey there! 

So, I know it's not exactly the coolest thing to do, but I think elementary schoolers should have to do community service. I mean, think about it, we're basically just sitting around all day, learning stuff and stuff. It's not like we're actually contributing to society or anything. But, if we did community service, we could be helping people and making a difference! 

First of all, community service can teach us important life skills like responsibility and empathy. Like, if we're helping out at a soup kitchen, we're not just sitting there playing games on our phones. We're actually helping people who are hungry and don't have enough food. And, if we're cleaning up a park, we're not just messing around, we're actually making the place cleaner and nicer for everyone. 

And, it's not like it has to take up a lot of time. Like, we could do it during recess or something. I mean, I know we have a lot of fun during recess, but think about how much more fun it would be if we were doing something good for the community instead of just playing tag. 

Plus, it can be really rewarding. Like, I heard about this one kid who did a community service project where he made blankets for homeless people. And, he was so happy and proud of himself when he finished. It was like, wow, he made a real difference in someone's life. 

So, yeah, I think elementary schoolers should totally have to do community service. It's not only good for us, but it's good for the community too. And, who knows, maybe one day we'll be the ones making the rules and we can make sure that community service is a requirement for everyone! 

Anyway, that's my speech. I hope you guys agree with me. Thanks for listening!

text:
"Hey everyone! Have you ever considered limiting your car usage? Maybe you haven't because it might seem like a hassle, but let me tell you about some of the advantages of doing so. Limiting car usage is beneficial to both the environment and your wallet!

First off, cars release harmful pollutants into the air that contribute to air pollution and global warming. According to a study by the Environmental Protection Agency, transportation accounts for nearly 30% of greenhouse gas emissions. This means that by limiting car usage, we can contribute to a cleaner environment and a healthier planet.

But it's not just about the environment. By using public transportation or walking/biking instead of driving, you can save money on gas, car maintenance, and even parking! This can add up to a significant amount over time. Plus, walking or biking is a great form of exercise that can also benefit your health.

In addition, limiting car usage can help reduce traffic congestion on our roads. With fewer cars on the road, it will be quicker and more efficient for those who do need to drive. This can also reduce the number of accidents and make our roads safer for everyone.

Overall, limiting car usage is a smart decision that benefits both the environment and your wallet. So why not try walking or biking to work or school, taking public transportation, or even carpooling with friends? You'll feel better knowing that you're doing your part to help reduce your carbon footprint and promote a cleaner, healthier environment for everyone."

text:
Working in a group can be incredibly beneficial compared to working alone. Group work allows us to gain knowledge from our peers, encouraging us to think outside of the box and come up with unique and creative solutions. For example, when I was working on a group project in college, I had the benefit of working alongside three other students who each had their own area of expertise. Together, we were able to create a highly effective solution that drew from each of our strengths, whereas if I was working alone, the quality of the results would have likely suffered. 

Furthermore, collaborating with peers on a project or task helps us stay organized and on task. We are more motivated to stay focused and complete the assignment in a timely manner than if we were working independently since we don't want to let our group members down. Plus, we are able to keep up with the progress of our peers, which adds a layer of accountability to each member of the group.

Despite the advantages of group work, some may argue that it can lead to wasted time and disagreements between peers. Yet, with proper planning and communication, these issues can be minimized. Establishing group rules and mutually agreed-upon goals can help ensure that everyone is on the same page and that decisions are being made efficiently. Additionally, setting due dates and holding each member of the team accountable to their individual tasks will help minimize conflicts and wasted time.

To sum up, working in a group comes with numerous benefits that can enhance the process and quality of completing an assignment. With proper planning and communication, disagreements and wasted time can be minimized, allowing groups to maximize their effectiveness. As demonstrated, group work can be much more beneficial than working alone and should be the preferred method for completing projects or tasks.
prompt:

Write an essay examining why working in a group can be more beneficial than working alone. Make sure to include examples and persuasive arguments in support of your thesis. Additionally, address counterclaims and use correct grammar in order to effectively persuade your readers.

text:
Hey there fellow cititzens! Today Im gonna tell you why we should limit car usage. First of all, cars are a big polluter. They release harmful gases like carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides into the air. This pollution is bad for our health and it also contributes to climate change. Climate change is a big problem that affects everyone on Earth. It causes things like sea level rise, more intense storms, and really hot summers. We should limit car usage to reduce the amount of pollution in the air.

Another reason we should limit car usage is that it's better for our health. When we drive cars, we're not getting any exercise. Exercise is important for our bodies and minds. It helps us stay healthy and strong. If we walk or bike instead of drive, we get exercise and we don't have to worry about pollution. Plus, walking and biking are fun! We can enjoy the fresh air and see the sights around us.

Cars also make a lot of noise. Have you ever noticed how loud it is when you're driving? It's like a big roar all around you. That noise is bad for our ears and it can make us stressed out. If we limit car usage, we can have a quieter, more peaceful community.

So what can we do instead of driving? We can walk, bike, or take public transportation. These are all great options that are better for our health and the environment. We can also carpool with our friends or family. This way, we can still use cars sometimes, but we'll be using them less often.

In conclusion, limiting car usage is a good idea for many reasons. It reduces pollution, it's better for our health, it makes our community quieter, and it helps us save money on gas. So let's try to use cars less often and use other ways to get around. We can make a difference!

I will be grading this essay using a 6th grade rubric.

Thank you!

text:
Hey there!  As an 8th grader, I've learned that making wise decisions is super important for our personal growth and the people around us.  Researching how to make wise decisions, understanding the consequences of bad decisions, and exploring why seeking guidance from experts is beneficial are some of the things I've learned. 

Firstly, making wise decisions can help us grow as individuals. When we make good choices, we feel good about ourselves and our lives.  For example, choosing to study hard for a test can lead to better grades and more opportunities in the future.  On the other hand, making bad decisions can have negative consequences, like getting bad grades or even failing a class.  That's why it's important to think carefully before making a decision.

But decisions don't just affect us, they also impact the people around us.  When we make good choices, we can inspire others to do the same.  For instance, if we volunteer in our community, we can encourage our friends and family to do the same, creating a positive impact on our community.  On the other hand, making bad decisions can hurt the people we care about.  For example, if we make a decision that hurts someone else, they might not want to be around us anymore.  That's why it's important to think about how our decisions can affect the people we love.

Seeking guidance from experts is super beneficial because they have more experience and knowledge than we do.  For instance, if we're trying to decide which college to attend, a guidance counselor can help us choose the best one for us.  They can also help us with big decisions like what career to pursue or how to handle tough situations.  By seeking guidance from experts, we can make better decisions and avoid making mistakes that might hurt us in the long run.

Lastly, it's important to appreciate life because it's short and can change in an instant. *looks out the window
prompt:
Task: 

1. Research ways to make wise decisions. 
2. Learn about the consequences of making bad decisions. 
3. Understand how decisions influence personal growth. 
4. Investigate how decisions can affect the people around us. 
5. Explore why seeking guidance from an expert is beneficial. 
6. Reflect on why it is important to appreciate life.
7. Compose an essay summarizing the importance of seeking guidance from experts and why

text:
Hey there, it's me again! 

So, I was reading this really cool essay prompt the other day and I was like, "Ooh, I wanna write about that!" And now I'm gonna do it! 

Okay, so the prompt is about this quote from Winston Churchill, who was like, a super smart and important dude, right? He said, "Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm." And I'm like, "Hmm, is that really true?"

So, I think it is true because when you fail, you can learn from your mistakes and get better next time! Like, if you try out for the basketball team and you don't make it, you can practice more and try out again the next year. And if you don't get the part in the school play, you can keep acting and singing and try out again. See? It's like, you can't give up just because you didn't succeed the first time.

But, some people might say, "No way, you don't need to fail to learn and be successful!" And I get that. Like, if you're really good at something, you might not need to fail to get better at it. But, for me, I'm not always the best at things, so I need to keep trying and learning.

And, I think it's also important to keep things in perspective. Like, if you don't get the grade you want on a test, it's not the end of the world! You can still learn from it and do better next time. And if you don't get the job you want, there are always other opportunities out there.

So, in conclusion, I think Churchill's quote is pretty true. Success doesn't come from never failing, but from learning from your mistakes and keeping on going! 

P.S. I hope my teacher doesn't see this and think I'm a total failure!
prompt:
Task: 

Write an essay exploring whether the statement attributed to former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill - "success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm" - is true. Discuss reasons for believing this statement is true, such as learning from mistakes and perseverance, as well as considering counterarguments that it is not necessary to fail to learn and succeed.

text:
Changing the school menu can be a controversial topic, as it has both positive and negative effects. On the one hand, it is undeniable that nutrition is important, especially for growing children. Introducing a more varied and balanced menu would offer students the proper assortment of nutrients needed for a healthy lifestyle. Additionally, children are more likely to taste new foods when their peers are trying them as well. This could help students be more adventurous eaters, resulting in healthier long-term dietary habits.

On the other hand, there is a risk of unfamiliar foods being met with negative responses. Many students resist change and may be unwilling to try new meals, particularly those which are not part of their culture or personal likes. Furthermore, the cost of introducing higher-quality ingredients may put financial strain on families, especially those whose budgets are already stretched thin. Finally, dining hall staff may need additional training to prepare the food, resulting in additional expenses.

In conclusion, while changing the school menu has the potential to bring multiple benefits to students, it is necessary to consider the potential drawbacks as well. Ultimately, the decision of whether to proceed with changing the school menu must be the result of careful deliberation and research on the topic.
prompt: Task: Write an essay discussing the pros and cons of changing the school menu.

text:
I believe that dress codes are beneficial to the school environment. Having a dress code in schools creates a positive learning environment by reducing distractions, increasing respect, and promoting equality among students. When students wear appropriate clothing to school, it helps to keep the focus on academics rather than fashion.

For instance, in schools where dress codes are not enforced, students might come to school wearing inappropriate clothing such as revealing or offensive clothing, which may cause distractions in the classroom. This can make it difficult for other students to concentrate on their studies.

Moreover, dress codes promote respect in schools. When students dress appropriately, they show respect for their teachers and peers. Wearing revealing clothing or clothing with offensive messages can be seen as disrespectful to the school community.

Finally, dress codes promote equality among students. When everyone is wearing the same type of clothing, it eliminates the pressure to keep up with the latest fashion trends. This helps students to focus on their studies rather than worrying about their clothing.

In conclusion, I believe that dress codes in schools are beneficial to the school environment. By reducing distractions, promoting respect, and promoting equality among students, schools can create a positive learning atmosphere for all.
prompt: Many schools have implemented a dress code to create a positive learning environment. Do you believe that dress codes are beneficial or detrimental to the school environment? Take a position and provide specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.

text:
Hey, I'm so stoked you're asking me to write this essay! 😃 Group work vs. solo work, it's a debate that's been going on for ages. I think it's super important to weigh the pros and cons of each and figure out how teachers can make group work the best it can be. 🤔

First off, let's talk about the advantages of working in a group. 🤝 When we work together, we can bounce ideas off each other and come up with way more creative solutions than we could on our own. Plus, it's way more fun! 🎉 We can learn from each other's strengths and weaknesses, and support each other when things get tough. Group work also helps us develop important social skills like communication, collaboration, and problem-solving. 💡

But, there are also some downsides to group work. 🤔 Sometimes, people don't pull their weight and the project doesn't get done as well as it could have. Or, people might not agree on what to do and it can get super confusing. 🤯 It's important for teachers to find ways to prevent these problems from happening. 💡

So, how can teachers facilitate group work in their classes? 🤔 First, they should make sure everyone knows their role and what's expected of them. That way, everyone's on the same page and can work together effectively. Next, teachers should give groups plenty of time to work on their project and check in with them regularly to make sure they're on track. 🕒 Finally, teachers should encourage open communication and problem-solving among groups, so they can work together to overcome any challenges they face. 💬

Now, here are three reasons why teachers should encourage students to work in groups: 🤔

1. It helps us develop important skills for the real world. 🌎 Whether we're working in a team at a job or collaborating on a project with friends, group work is a crucial part of life. By practicing in school, we can become better at working together and achieving our goals.
prompt:
Task: 

1. Research the advantages and disadvantages of working in a group versus working alone.
2. Write down your observations about how teachers should facilitate group work in their classes.
3. Brainstorm three reasons why teachers should encourage students to work in groups.
4. Make a list of activities that should be done in groups.
5. Write an essay that summarizes the advantages of working in a group and explains why teachers should allow students to opt into group work.

text:
The Face on Mars has been a topic of discussion for many years, with some people believing that it was created by aliens. However, as a scientist at NASA, I strongly believe that the Face is just a natural landform on Mars. There are several claims and evidence from the article 'Unmasking the Face on Mars' to support this argument.

Firstly, the Face on Mars is not as perfect as some people claim it to be. In reality, it is just a mesa, a flat-topped mountain, that looks like a human face from a certain angle. This is supported by the fact that the Face has been photographed from different angles, and it does not look like a face from all of them. Therefore, it is not a perfect human face and cannot be a creation of aliens.

Secondly, the formation of the Face can be explained by natural geological processes. According to the article, the Face was created by erosion, where the surrounding area was eroded away, leaving the mesa behind. This is a common geological process on Earth, and there is no reason why it cannot happen on Mars. Therefore, there is no need for an explanation involving aliens.

Lastly, the idea that aliens created the Face on Mars is not supported by any scientific evidence. The article explains that there is no evidence of any intelligent life on Mars or anywhere else in the universe. Without any evidence, it is not logical to jump to the conclusion that aliens created the Face.

In conclusion, the Face on Mars is not a creation of aliens, but a natural landform on the planet. There is no evidence to support the idea that aliens created the Face, and it can be explained by natural geological processes. It is essential to approach such topics with an open mind and rely on scientific evidence to draw conclusions. Therefore, as a scientist at NASA, I strongly urge people to consider the scientific explanation of the Face on Mars, which is that it is a natural mesa.
prompt: You have read the article 'Unmasking the Face on Mars.' Imagine you are a scientist at NASA discussing the Face with someone who thinks it was created by aliens. Using information in the article, write an argumentative essay to convince someone that the Face is just a natural landform.Be sure to include: claims to support your argument that the Face is a natural landform; evidence from the article to support your claims; an introduction, a body, and a conclusion to your argumentative essay.

text:
Standardized tests have long been a topic of debate among educators and students. Some people believe that standardized tests are an accurate representation of a student's ability, while others think the complete opposite. In this essay, I will state my position on whether standardized tests are an accurate measure of student ability.

To begin with, standardized tests are not an adequate measure of a student's intelligence. Students' intelligence can't be measured based on a single test. Some students have test anxiety, making it difficult for them to perform well during an examination. For instance, I'm an excellent speaker, but when it comes to writing and reading comprehension tests, I become anxious.

Additionally, students are more than just test scores. Standardized tests don't take into account creativity, problem-solving, or any other essential skill needed for real-life situations. A student who doesn't perform well on standardized tests might excel in other subjects. In other words, a single test shouldn't determine a student's future.

Furthermore, standardized tests have become the main focus on schools, which means that they are putting more emphasis on the exams rather than on a student's overall academic performance. This approach leads to an unbalanced education, where other subjects like arts and physical education are neglected.

In conclusion, I believe that standardized tests are not the best measure of a student's ability, as they only measure a portion of a students’ overall potential. A student’s performance should be based on multiple factors like academic work, creativity, critical thinking, problem-solving, and more. By relying on standardized tests solely, it creates an unbalanced approach to education, which isn't beneficial to the students or the school.
prompt: The use of standardized testing in schools has been a topic of debate for many years. Write an essay stating your position on whether standardized tests are an accurate measure of student ability, using specific reasons and examples to support your argument.

text:
I think it's important to talk about the use of animals in scientific research because it's a big issue that affects a lot of living beings. I understand that scientists want to help people and make new discoveries, but I don't think it's right to use animals to do that.

First of all, animals are living beings too, and they have feelings and rights just like we do. It's not fair to use them for our own benefit, especially when they can't even say no or give their permission. Imagine if we were the ones being used in experiments and we couldn't do anything about it! It would be really scary and unfair.

Secondly, animals are not always necessary for scientific research. There are lots of other ways to test things out, like using cells or computer models. These methods are not only more humane, but they can also be more accurate and cost-effective in the long run.

Furthermore, some scientists have been using animals in ways that are not ethical. For example, they might use animals that are endangered or they might hurt the animals more than they need to. This is not only bad for the animals, but it's also against the law in some cases.

On the other hand, some people might argue that animals are necessary for scientific research because they help us find new treatments and medicines. While it's true that animals have been used in some important discoveries, I think we can find other ways to do it that don't involve hurting animals.

In conclusion, I think we should try to use fewer animals in scientific research and look for other ways to test things out. It's not only the right thing to do for the animals, but it's also better for us in the long run. By being more creative and compassionate, we can make science better and more ethical for everyone.
prompt: The use of animals in scientific research has been a topic of ethical debate. Argue for or against the use of animals in scientific research, providing reasons and examples to justify your position.

text:
Dear Principal,

I am writing to you to express my thoughts on the school's cell phone policy. I believe that the school should adopt policy 1, which allows students to bring phones to school and use them during lunch periods and other free times, as long as the phones are turned off during class time.

Firstly, having a cell phone is important for emergencies. If there is an emergency, such as a student getting hurt or a family emergency, students can quickly contact their parents or emergency services. This can help keep students safe and ensure that they receive the help they need in a timely manner.

Secondly, many students rely on their phones for communication. For example, some students may need to contact their parents to arrange for a ride home or to let them know that they will be late. Additionally, some students may need to communicate with their teachers or classmates about schoolwork or projects. Allowing students to use their phones during lunch periods and other free times can help facilitate this communication.

Finally, having a cell phone can promote responsibility and trust. If students are allowed to have phones at school, they will be responsible for keeping them safe and not using them during class time. This can help build trust between students and teachers, as it shows that students are capable of following rules and being responsible.

I understand that some people may argue that cell phones can be a distraction during class time. However, policy 1 addresses this issue by requiring students to turn off their phones during class time. This ensures that students are not distracted by their phones and can focus on their studies.

In conclusion, I believe that policy 1 is the better choice for our school's cell phone policy. It allows students to have access to their phones for emergencies and communication, while also promoting responsibility and trust. Thank you for considering my opinion on this matter.

Sincerely,

[Your name]
prompt:
Your principal is reconsidering the school's cell phone policy. She is considering two possible policies: 
Policy 1: Allow students to bring phones to school and use them during lunch periods and other free times, as long as the phones are turned off during class time. 
Policy 2: Do not allow students to have phones at school at all.
Write a letter to your principal convincing her which policy you believe is better. Support your position with specific reasons.

text:
"I do not agree that video games can contribute to violent behavior. There are many other factors that contribute to violence and aggression in individuals, such as personal experiences or mental health issues. Video games alone cannot be held responsible for causing violence.

Firstly, most video games are designed with a rating system that indicates the level of violence or appropriateness for different age groups. This ensures that players are aware of the content they will be exposed to and can choose to play games that are suitable for them. It is the responsibility of parents or guardians to monitor their child's gaming habits and ensure they are playing games that are age-appropriate.

Secondly, video games can actually have beneficial effects on behavior. Many games require problem-solving and critical thinking skills, which can improve cognitive abilities. Some games also promote teamwork and cooperation, encouraging players to work together towards a common goal. These positive aspects of gaming should be considered when discussing the impact of video games on behavior.

Finally, there is a lack of strong evidence linking video games directly to violent behavior. Studies have shown mixed results, with some suggesting a correlation between violent games and aggression, while others find no significant relationship. It is important to consider these conflicting findings before jumping to conclusions about the impact of video games on behavior.

In conclusion, while it is important to monitor the content of video games and ensure age-appropriate play, blaming them for violent behavior is unfair and overlooks other contributing factors. Instead, we should focus on educating individuals about responsible gaming habits and addressing underlying causes of violence and aggression."
prompt: There is an ongoing debate about the impact of video games on behavior. Argue for or against the idea that video games can contribute to violent behavior, providing reasons and examples to support your position.

text:
High school graduation is often looked upon as a milestone for students to celebrate as the end of a long educational journey. However, some school districts have begun allowing students to graduate a year early. Though this can be beneficial in certain cases, there are several compelling reasons why this practice should not be made universally available to all high school students. 

Most importantly, graduates who jump the gun and finish high school early could be missing out on valuable learning experiences. High school is a formative period and the curriculum is designed to prepare young adults for college or the workforce. Skipping ahead by a year could lead to students not having enough guidance or mentorship available while learning vital skills and life lessons. 

In addition, early graduation can leave students feeling unprepared for the world outside of high school. Not having the same college exposure as other peers or lacking the maturity that comes with an extra year of school can hold graduates back from success in the long-run. Graduating a year earlier than expected does not always mean students will attend college earlier; in fact, it could mean starting a career ill-equipped to handle all the responsibilities that come with being a full-time working adult. 

For these reasons, schools districts should not make it possible for all high school students to graduate a year early. The benefits may be enticing, but there are many potential downsides to consider.
prompt: Task: Write an essay arguing why schools districts should not allow high school kids to graduate a year early.

It's like, you're not gonna keep making the same mistake over and over again, right? Secondly, when things go wrong, you get to show off your problem-solving skills!  Like, you might encounter a problem that you've never faced before, but if you're determined to find a solution, you can use your creativity and resourcefulness to figure it out.  It's like, you get to show everyone that you're not gonna let a little setback hold you back! 

Lastly, when things go wrong, you get to grow as a person!  Like, you might fail at something, but if you don't give up, you can use that experience to become a stronger and more resilient person.  It's like, you're not gonna let one little failure define you, you're gonna keep going and keep trying until you succeed! 

So, there you have it!  When things go wrong, they might seem like a huge problem at first, but if you take the time to reflect on what went wrong and how to fix it, you can turn it into a chance to do your best!  Thanks for reading my essay!
prompt: Task: Write an essay discussing why a problem is a chance to do your best because you learn from your mistakes. Include at least three reasons or examples why this might be true.

text:
Praising students for their work is an important part of creating a positive and encouraging educational environment. Studies have shown that providing students with feedback and recognition has a positive impact on their academic performance, engagement, and general motivation. Furthermore, research indicates that students who receive praise are more likely to develop more resilient and self-reliant attitudes. This helps them develop a more effective way of tackling problems, building confidence in their academic skills and capabilities. 

It is crucial for both teachers and parents to provide meaningful and appropriate praise to their students and children. When praising students, teachers and parents should focus on their effort, accomplishments, and the value of their work instead of their raw performance or results. This will help students recognize their strengths and abilities, as well as become more motivated to set and achieve goals. Regular praise that is genuine and supportive also helps to boost students’ self-esteem and reduce their fear of failure.

Praise is an effective tool for educators and guardians, and it is important to ensure that it is given appropriately and frequently. Doing so ensures that students are provided with clear and positive reinforcement to help them succeed in their educational journey.
prompt: Task: Write an academic essay on why it is important for teachers and parents to praise students for their work.

text:
One of the most controversial topics to discuss in the education system is the degree to which schools should control the involvement of extracurricular activities. The pros and cons of having schools control every aspect of extracurricular activities must be considered. On the one hand, there are significant benefits to having schools set strict regulations and enforce strict guidelines. Through this, schools can provide students with a safe and secure environment in which to explore and engage in new activities. Moreover, it ensures that the activities offered are of the highest quality, allowing students to really get the most out of their experience.

On the other hand, overly controlling the extracurricular activities available to students can have a negative impact on students. By limiting the opportunities available to students, schools may limit student creativity and exploration. Students may be discouraged from pursuing activities that may not be officially recognized by the school, but that could still have an enormous benefit to them. Additionally, students may become frustrated by the unnecessary restrictions imposed on them, which could lead to a lower sense of self-confidence or a decrease in academic performance.

Overall, it is important for schools to carefully consider their approach to extracurricular activities, as there are both benefits and drawbacks to having a high level of control over what is offered to students. Ultimately, a balance must be struck between providing students with a safe and secure environment and giving them the freedom to explore and create. By doing this, the educational experience of each student can be enriched and improved.
prompt: Task: Write an essay discussing the pros and cons of schools controlling the involvement of extracurricular activities.

text:
When it comes to making important decisions, neither of the options - asking for guidance from experts or relying solely on your own instincts and ideas - are necessarily better than the other. It all depends on the situation and the individual. For instance, when I was trying to make a decision about what college to attend, I found myself relying heavily on the opinions of experts and other people who had been in a similar situation before. Although I valued my own self-reliance, hearing experienced perspectives gave me valuable insight into what I should take into account when making this decision. This allowed me to make a more informed and confident decision.

At the same time, it's important to note that I still trusted my own instincts and ideas. I weighed the expert advice I received against my own opinion and decided which one was best for me. It's always okay to ask for help even if you value self-reliance - it's a sign of strength. Asking for help can help you make the best decision based on other people’s experience and knowledge, and still allow you to rely on your instincts to make the final decision.
prompt: Task: Analyze the benefits of asking for guidance from experts when making a decision and compare this to relying self-reliance on one's own instincts and ideas. Discuss why it is okay to ask for help even when person values their self-reliance.

text:
Dear Principal Smith,

I am writing to express my concern over the school's policy of only allowing B range students on teams and other activities. I am proposing that the policy should be changed to C range, and I have two reasons to support this argument. 

Firstly, by only allowing B range students, the school is inadvertently preventing many C range students from participating in activities that could prove beneficial to their mental and physical wellbeing. Activities such as sports and other team-based events can provide students with a great sense of success and accomplishment, and can also act as a valuable form of stress relief. Of course, B range students can benefit from these activities too, but by limiting participation to those students, the school is denying C range students an opportunity to experience the positive effects of sports and team-based activities.

Secondly, allowing C range students to participate in teams and other activities could help to break down stigmas and encourage greater inclusivity throughout the school. The current policy may suggest to C range students that they are not good enough to participate in certain activities, and this can negatively affect their sense of self-worth and belonging. By changing the policy to allow all students to participate, regardless of their grades, it could positively impact the school environment and promote a sense of social solidarity amongst students.

In conclusion, I am advocating for the school to change its policy to a C range for teams and other activities. This will ensure that all students, regardless of grades, are able to experience the benefits of teamwork and physical activity, and will also help to create a more inclusive environment. 

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
prompt:
Task: 

Write a persuasive essay to the principal explaining why the school’s policy of only allowing B range students on teams and other activities should be changed to C range. Include at least two reasons and provide examples to support your argument.

text:
Hey there, teacher! 

So, you know how they say you only get one chance to make a first impression?  Yeah, it's totally true. I mean, think about it. When you meet someone new, you're like, judging them instantly, right?  And once that first impression is made, it's kinda hard to change it.

Like, I remember the first time I met my best friend, Emily.  She was sitting alone at lunch, and I thought she looked kinda lonely, so I went over to talk to her. And we hit it off, big time!  But if I had walked by her and seen her looking sad, I might've thought she was weird or something. 

But here's the thing: first impressions aren't always accurate.  Like, I used to think that people who wore glasses were smart and nerdy, but then I realized that's not always the case.  My brother's actually really cool and athletic, but he wears glasses, so I used to think he was a total brainiac. 

And it's not just with people, either.  I used to think that my cat was gonna be a total grump, but turns out, she's super affectionate and loves to play.  So, yeah, first impressions can be way off.

But, even though they might not always be right, they can still shape how we view people and how we interact with them.  Like, if someone gives me a weird vibe, I'm gonna be way more hesitant to talk to them.  It's just human nature, I guess.

BUT,  over time, we can change our first impressions.  Like, if someone shows me that they're actually super nice and cool, I'll start to see them in a different light.  And that's what's so great about getting to know people - you can learn so much more about them
prompt: Task: Examine the impact of first impressions on interactions with others. Analyze how your own experiences have shaped how you view first impressions and how these impressions can change over time.

Hey there, it's me again!  So, you know how we've been talking about extending the student release time at our school?  Well, I did some research on it and here are my thoughts! 

First of all, let's talk about student well-being.  I think extending the release time could be really good for us because it means we'll have more time to relax and do things we enjoy.  Like, I know some people like to play sports or join clubs, and with more time, they'll be able to do that.  Plus, it'll give us more time to hang out with our friends and catch up on our schoolwork.  I mean, who doesn't love having extra time to procrastinate? 

But,  I also think it could be tough on our parents.  They might have to pick us up from school later, which could be a pain for them.  And,  some parents might not be able to pick us up on time, which could be really stressful for them.  So, we should probably talk to our parents about it and see how they feel. 

Oh, and  one more thing!  Extending the release time could also affect our after-school transportation.  Like, some kids might not be able to take the bus or get a ride from their parents, so they might have to walk or bike home.  And,  that could be dangerous for them, especially if they live far away.  So, we should probably figure out a way to make sure everyone gets home safely. 

So,  overall, I think extending the student release time could be a good thing, but we need to make sure we consider everyone's feelings and make sure everything is safe and good for everyone. *
prompt: Task: Research the potential implications of extending the student release time at a school. Include analysis of student well-being, impact on parents, and impact on after-school transportation.

text:
Hey, Mrs. Johnson! Here's my essay on the importance of being honest all the time:

Being honest is something that I think is super important in life. Like, duh, right? But I feel like a lot of people don't realize how much it can impact your relationships and stuff. Like, when you're in a friendship or something, you gotta be honest with them, even if it's like, hard. Like, if you don't like someone, you should just tell them instead of pretending to like them. It's better to be upfront and honest instead of leading them on or something.

And when you mess up, you gotta be honest about it too. Like, if you break something or do something wrong, you should own up to it and apologize. It's not cool to try to cover it up or make excuses. It's better to be honest and take responsibility for your actions.

And in arguments, you gotta be honest about how you're feeling. Like, if you're mad or upset, you should tell them instead of bottling it up. It's better to work through the issue instead of letting it build up and causing more problems.

In my own life, I've learned the importance of being honest the hard way. Like, there was this one time when I accidentally broke my friend's favorite toy, and I was like, so embarrassed. But instead of lying or making excuses, I just told her the truth and apologized. And she was actually really understanding and stuff. So it worked out in the end.

Another time, I got into an argument with my brother, and we were both being super dishonest about how we were feeling. But then we sat down and talked about it, and we both realized that we were feeling the same way. So we were able to work through it and come to a resolution.

Anyway, being honest is just something that I think is really important in life. It's not always easy, but it's worth it in the end. So, yeah, that's my essay! Thanks for reading! 😃
prompt: Task: Write an essay discussing the importance of being honest all the time. text:
Deciding on a career at a young age can have both benefits and drawbacks. It can provide direction and motivation, allowing a young person to create plans and work towards achieving a career goal. On the other hand, there may not be job availability in the desired field, making success difficult to attain. Economic stability is also an issue; parents may not have the financial resources to help cover costs if the career requires expensive training or qualifications.

Furthermore, picking a career too early can lead to risks such as missing out on exploring other opportunities or feeling pressured to make a specific decision. This can have a detrimental effect on mental health and personal growth, as young people may be stuck in a career that doesn't align with their interests and passions. It is therefore important to carefully weigh all the potential risks and benefits when making this decision.

text:
I believe that dress codes are beneficial for the school environment. There are several reasons for this. Firstly, dress codes help promote a positive learning environment by ensuring that students are dressed appropriately for school. This means that students are not wearing clothing that is too revealing or distracting, which can be a distraction for other students and teachers. For example, if a student is wearing a shirt with a revealing neckline, it may be difficult for other students to focus on their work or for the teacher to concentrate on teaching.

Secondly, dress codes help to promote equality among students. If everyone is wearing the same type of clothing, it eliminates the competition to see who has the most expensive or trendy clothes. This can help to reduce bullying and social pressure that can be caused by clothing choices.

Thirdly, dress codes can help to prepare students for the real world. Most jobs have dress codes, and by enforcing a dress code at school, students are learning how to dress appropriately for different situations. This is an important life skill that they will need in the future.

In conclusion, I believe that dress codes are beneficial for the school environment. They help to promote a positive learning environment, promote equality among students, and prepare students for the real world. By enforcing a dress code, we can create a more focused, respectful, and professional school culture.
prompt: Many schools have implemented a dress code to create a positive learning environment. Do you believe that dress codes are beneficial or detrimental to the school environment? Take a position and provide specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.

text:
Hey there! 

So, I'm supposed to write an essay about how important it is to agree with other people and take their opinions into consideration.  Like, I get it. It's like, super important to be able to see things from other people's perspectives and stuff. But, like, how do I even start? 

Okay, so, Ralph Waldo Emerson said something really cool about how agreement is like, the key to bringing people's experiences together.  He said, "The only way to have a friend is to be one."  Like, whoa. That's deep. It's like, if we can't agree with each other, how are we gonna learn from each other? 

I mean, think about it. When we agree with someone, we're like, able to see things from their point of view. It's like, we're both on the same page, you know?  And that's when we can really start to understand each other. Like, we can learn from each other's experiences and stuff. It's like, a two-way street, you know?

But, like, sometimes we don't always have to agree with each other.  Like, if someone's opinion is, like, totally different from mine, I'm not gonna just blindly agree with them.  But, like, I can still listen to what they have to say and try to see things from their perspective.  It's like, respecting their opinion, even if I don't totally agree with it.

So, in conclusion, agreeing with other people and taking their opinions into consideration is, like, super important.  It's like, the key to understanding each other and growing as individuals.  And, like, Ralph Waldo Emerson said it best: "The only way to have a friend is to be one." 

Thanks for reading, I guess.

text:
Dear Ms. Smith,

I think Policy 1 is the better choice for our school. I know some people might think that having phones at school is distracting, but I think it's important for us to have them.

First of all, it's important for us to be able to communicate with our parents. What if there's an emergency and we need to call them? Or what if they need to reach us? It's a lot easier if we have our phones. Plus, it's not like we're going to be on them all the time. We'll only use them during lunch and free time, when we're not in class.

Another reason why Policy 1 is better is that it's more realistic. A lot of us have phones already, and it's not like we're going to stop using them just because they're not allowed at school. If we're not allowed to have them, we'll just find ways to sneak them in. And that's not fair to the students who follow the rules.

Also, having phones at school can actually help us learn. We can use them to look up information for projects or to access online resources. And we can also use them to take pictures of whiteboard notes or to record lectures. That way, we can review the material later.

I understand that some people might worry about bullying or distractions, but I think that's not a good reason to ban phones altogether. We should focus on teaching students how to use technology responsibly, rather than just taking it away from them.

I hope you'll consider Policy 1 and allow us to have phones at school. Thank you for listening to my opinion.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

Sure, here's my attempt at writing an essay as an average 8th grade student on the topic of graduating from high school in three years:

Hey, guys! Today we're talking about this thing where some schools are starting to let students graduate from high school in three years instead of four. Like, I know some people are all for it, but I'm not so sure. Let me tell you why.

First of all, the pros. So, if you graduate in three years, you get to start college or get a job sooner. That's like, a whole year earlier than everyone else! And, you know, who doesn't want to get ahead in life? Plus, it's like, less time you have to spend in high school, which can be super stressful. I mean, I know some people who are just not ready to leave high school yet, and it's like, totally understandable.

But, here's the thing. I don't know if I could handle three years of high school. Like, I know it's gonna be hard and all, but I'm not sure I could handle that much work. And, what if I don't get into college? Like, what if I don't meet the requirements or something? That would be so embarrassing. And, I don't know if I want to skip out on all that fun stuff we do in high school, like prom and stuff. It's like, part of the experience, you know?

And, let's not forget about the social stuff. Like, I know some people who are gonna be in high school for four years, and they're gonna have more time to make friends and stuff. And, I don't know if I could keep up with them if I'm in school for three years. It's like, they'll have more time to bond and stuff, and I'll be left behind.

So, yeah. That's my take on it. I don't know if I could handle graduating from high school in three years. It's like, a lot of pressure and stress, and I'm not sure I'm ready for that. But, hey, if you're into it, go for it
prompt: Task: Research the pros and cons of graduating from high school in three years, and write an essay discussing whether students should do it or not.

text:
Dear Mrs. Smith,

I think that requiring a grade B average to participate in sports or other activities is a bad idea. Firstly, not everyone is good at school and some people might not be able to get a B average no matter how hard they try. This would be unfair to those people because they would be punished for something they can't control.

Secondly, some people might be really good at sports or other activities and this would be a way for them to express themselves and show their talents. If they can't participate because of their grades, then they might become discouraged and not want to do anything.

Lastly, having at least a B average to participate would put a lot of pressure on students. Some students might feel stressed and anxious about getting good grades, and this could affect their performance in school and in sports.

I think it's important to remember that school is not just about grades, it's also about learning and having fun. Sports and other activities are a way for students to have fun and be active, and they should be available to everyone, not just the students who are good at school.

I hope you will consider my arguments and not make this policy change.

Sincerely,

John.

Please provide feedback on the essay and suggest possible improvements.

Also, please provide a grade based on the content and effort put into the essay.

Please note: The essay is written as if it were a grade 9 student, so please consider that when providing feedback and grading.
prompt:
Your principal is considering changing school policy so that students may not participate in sports or other activities unless they have at least a grade B average. Many students have a grade C average. 
She would like to hear the students' views on this possible policy change. Write a letter to your principal arguing for or against requiring at least a grade B average to participate in sports or other activities. Be sure to support your arguments with specific reasons.

text:
Dear Principal,

I am writing to you regarding the issue of community service for students. I understand that some of my friends believe community service is important, while others feel it takes too much time away from their personal needs and wants. As a student in grade 9, I have my own opinion on this matter.

In my opinion, students should be required to perform community service. Firstly, community service provides an opportunity for students to help others in need. For example, tutoring elementary school children is a great way for students to give back to the community, and it can make a huge difference in the lives of those they tutor. Secondly, community service can also help students develop important skills such as teamwork, leadership, and communication. These skills will not only benefit them in their academic and personal lives but also in their future careers.

I understand that some students may feel that community service takes away from their personal time, but I believe that the benefits of community service far outweigh the drawbacks. Students can choose to perform community service during their free time, such as on weekends or during breaks, so that it does not interfere with their schoolwork or other obligations.

In conclusion, I strongly believe that students should be required to perform community service. It not only benefits the community but also helps students develop important skills that will benefit them in the future. Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
prompt:
Some of your friends perform community service. For example, some tutor elementary school children and others clean up litter. They think helping the community is very important. But other friends of yours think community service takes too much time away from what they need or want to do. 
Your principal is deciding whether to require all students to perform community service. 
Write a letter to your principal in which you take a position on whether students should be required to perform community service. Support your position with examples.

text:
I think that we should all go vegan! Meat is bad for the earth and for our bodies. First, it takes a lot of water to grow food for animals. Like, did you know it takes 1,000 gallons of water to make just one pound of beef? That's crazy! We could use that water for people who don't have any. And it's not just water, it's also space. Cows take up so much room and they make so much poop. It's bad for the soil and it's bad for the air. We should just eat plants instead. They're good for us and they don't hurt the earth as much. Plus, plants are yummy! Have you tried tofu? It's so good! And you can put it in anything. My favorite is tofu stir-fry with broccoli and carrots. It's so good!

Also, meat is bad for our bodies. My mom's friend had a heart attack and the doctor said it was because he ate too much meat. He had to go vegan and now he's way healthier. My mom too, she used to eat a lot of meat and now she has diabetes. But since she started eating more plants, she feels better. I don't want to get diabetes or have a heart attack, so I'm going to eat more plants too.

I know some people might say that we need meat for protein, but that's just not true. You can get protein from plants too. Like, beans and lentils have a lot of protein. And they're so yummy! My favorite is black bean tacos. They're so good! And they're good for you too.

I also know that some people might say that it's too hard to go vegan because you can't eat certain things. But it's not that hard. You can still eat pizza, just without the pepperoni. You can still have pasta, just without the meatballs. And there are so many yummy vegan desserts! Have you tried vegan chocolate chip cookies? They're the best!

So, we should all go vegan. It's good for the earth and it's good for our bodies. It's not that hard and it's yummy. We should all try it!
